title: Set f(0) As the y-coordinate
text: We know that $$x=0$$ in the y-intercept. We can compute f(0) to find the y coordinate if y-intercept. What is f(0)?

title: Put The Answer Into (x,y)
text: $$f(0)=-1\times0^2-14\times0-49=-49$$. We get $$x=0$$ and $$y=-49$$ for y-intercept. Put together, we have (0,-49) as y-intercept.
